name: Luther Hughes
bio:
Luther Hughes is the author of the poetry chapbook Touched (Sibling Rivalry Press, 2018) and is founder of Shade Literary Arts. He earned a BA from Columbia College Chicago and an MFA from Washington University in St. Louis. His poems have appeared in Poetry magazine, Paris Review, the Rumpus, Foglifter Journal, New England Review, Washington Square Review, Columbia Poetry Review, and elsewhere. His essays have appeared in Poetry Northwest, Hayden's Ferry Review, the Seattle Times, and Winter Tangerine. In 2020, Hughes received a Ruth Lilly and Dorothy Sargent Rosenberg Poetry Fellowship from the Poetry Foundation and was a winner of the 92Y Discovery Poetry Contest.
Hughes has worked as an editor for Habitat Magazine, Columbia Poetry Review, Frontier Poetry, YesYes Books, and the Offing, where he currently serves as executive editor. He is also a co-host of the Poet Salon podcast. He lives near Seattle.
